After many months of tireless community-based efforts to ensure a complete count in the Capital Region, I am disappointed and angered at this eleventh-hour decision that strips the American people of their voice, fair representation and entitled resources.
The pandemic as well as attempts to scare certain communities has made an accurate count more difficult.

This ruling undermines this Constitutional duty, guarantees an inaccurate reflection of our nation‚Äôs composition and denies our communities their fair share of federal funding for health care, education, infrastructure and many more vital services for the next ten years.

The announcement today by the U.S. Supreme Court to allow this Administration to cut the Census short is a direct assault on our communities and our democracy. Article I, Section 2 of our Constitution mandates a complete count of every person living in the United States.
